By utilizing PSMWriter software, all necessary employees have access to every aspect of the RMP-PSM program. This has improved Vignolo Farms Potato Shed's ability to communicate hazardous situations to employees and contractors. In addition, PSMWriter tracks all RMP-PSM related events so that Vignolo Farms Potato Shed's management team can ensure that the RMP-PSM program is being implemented.

Vignolo Farms Potato Shed has implemented all aspects of the RMP-PSM program. When a RMP-PSM program requirement is completed (i.e. mechanical integrity inspection, process hazard analysis, compliance audit, etc.) any specific action items related to that event are entered into PSMWriter, assigned a responsible person, and given a due date. Once the action item has been completed, the resolution can be documented using PSMWriter as well. A list of current or past due action items can be accessed at any time by those with access to PSMWriter.

In addition to utilizing PSMWriter to create, schedule, track, and document events, Vignolo Farms Potato Shed has also entered into a contract with Resource Compliance to obtain help with RMP-PSM program implementation. A copy of Resource Compliance's service agreement has been included in this program with the support material.

For the future, Vignolo Farms Potato Shed now thinks of the RMP-PSM program as a living document. It is an interactive framework that guides safe action for Vignolo Farms Potato Shed employees, but allows for feedback and continual improvement. Through the RMP-PSM program Vignolo Farms Potato Shed will continue to maintain overall plant worker and public safety.

1.3.3	CHLORINE

The chlorination process at the Vignolo Farms Potato Shed facility is an integral part of the overall business and operates for only a few months out of the year. As with the ammonia process management is committed to making sure that employees are made aware of the potential danger of a chlorine leak. 

Vignolo Farms Potato Shed personnel monitor the chlorination process. In addition, the process is checked frequently during the operational season by our outside water treatment contractor. This contractor also assists in performing the annual mechanical integrity review of our chlorine equipment. 

1.4	FIVE YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY

Vignolo Farms Potato Shed has had no accidental release within the last five (5) years.

1.2	PROCESS DESCRIPTIONS

1.2.1.1.1	Vignolo Farms Potato Shed

The chlorine process at Vignolo Farms is an integral part of the potato processing business which operates for only a few months out of the year.   The chlorine process operates as follows:
1.	Chlorine one-ton containers are delivered by chlorine vendor and then connected to the process by Vignolo personnel
2.	When water treatment is required the water pump for the chlorination system is turned on.
3.	An ejector installed in the water pump discharge line draws chlorine gas through a regulator mounted on the one-ton container.
4.	The highly acidic chlorinated water downstream of the ejector is dumped into a buffer tank where the pH is neutralized. 
5.	Chlorinated, buffered water with a neutral pH is sent to the Potato Wash process and then to the Pit.
6.	Empty cylinders are disconnected from the process and removed from the facility by the chlorine vender for refilling.

1.2.1.1.6	The chlorine process at this facility consists of vessels which are interconnected, or which are co-located such that a release of chlorine could impact the ability to operate vessels that are not directly connected.  Therefore, the system is treated as a single process.
